title: symbol for abbreviation for Century
content:
Hi  
I am designing a program for an early music group  
and instead of putting "a song from C18th Italy"  
I would like to have the "C" go round the "18th"  
Is this possible?  
Thanks for your help
author: allemande

comments.content:
I'm not familiar with this kind of stylistic abbreviations but technically I see no reason why it couldn't be possible. Make the C bigger (set lighter style if available, for strokes' optical consistency), lower it's baseline; analogically, scale down the "18th" (heavier style) and raise it. Then set negative kerning between both, simple and quite obvious if you're working with InDesign or similar software. Here's a quick sample:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150421234929im_/http:/typophile.com/files/sample_5531.png)
